item.title: Lvl 126
item.dc:creator: @0uch_a_arr0w 0uch a arr0w
item.description:
@0uch_a_arr0w wrote:

One min[br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2007, 08:35:30 PM[/size][hr][quote=“3 HITTED U, post:6, topic:73699”][code]public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 225.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		if (lvl >= level) {
			return output;
		}
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
	}
	return 0;
}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 225.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 99;
}[/code]

Should work.[/quote]= 185

Read full topic

item.title: Lvl 126
item.dc:creator: @P3rscape P3rscape
item.description:
@P3rscape wrote:

Alright got it.:

[code]public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		if (lvl >= level) {
			return output;
		}
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
	}
	return 0;
}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 99;
}[/code] replace that with this:)

Hope this helped!

item.title: Lvl 126
item.dc:creator: @0uch_a_arr0w 0uch a arr0w
item.description:
@0uch_a_arr0w wrote:

[code]public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		if (lvl >= level) {
			return output;
		}
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
	}
	return 0;
}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 99;
}[/code]

I have tried many,many,many times to get this done :(. All times unsuccessful. I have been told it has something to do with the 300.0 in there but I wasn’t told rightly.

I would be so greatfull if someone could tell me what to do about the 300.0 to make 126 combat the max?

Thanks in advance.
